title: SoC RTVF 360-0-23 Topics in Media Writing

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Course Description: Students will study character, story, plot, dialogue, scene structure and screenplay format across various genres. The course will include reading, screening and discussion of feature films with the goal of a creating logline, treatment, character biography and generating the first half of a feature film for critique and feedback.
Learning Objectives
To understand the process of developing a story for the visual medium
To understand the importance of character in relation to plot
To strengthen the necessary elements of screenwriting (action, dialogue, etc.)
To understand traditional and alternative screenplay structures and form.
Appreciate the script's contribution to a successful film.
Teaching Method
Lectures, discussions, screenings, class reading, and writing assignments
Evaluation Method
Attendance, discussions, class participation, written assignments
Class Materials (Required)
Various electronic handouts
Various Screenplays (TBA)
Class Materials (Suggested)
Screenplay - Syd Field
Alternative Screenwriting - Ken Dancyger & Jeff Rush
The Hollywood Standard - Christopher Riley
An Actor Prepares - Constantin Stanislavski
Notes
Most of the written work will be read out loud in class, including screenplay scenes. This is a vital component of the class, to better understand the written (and unwritten) words, as they move the story forward.
